Posts.Content: clevelandgirl99 wrote: But this waiting is driving me crazy!!!!  I am hoping to hear tomorrow.  I try not to think about it, but walking on the stairs I can still feel where they did my biopsy.  Dang thing didn't close.  Had my mom (who is retierd RN) check it yesterday and she called it a "gaping wound"  Slightly exaggerated in my mind, but she was correct that the steri strips didn't work.  She put a couple butterfly bandages on, and I am sure it's A-OK now.  But just one more thing with this never ending saga. It's been since May that there has been one issue or another.  All of these tests and procedures for what I am sure will be B9 results.  Not sure it's worth all of the stress and money. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm sure in in the 80% clevelandgirl99 solange49

Posts.Content: clevelandgirl99 wrote: Had mri biopsy on Friday.  Hope to have results Tuesday.  Can't find out soon enough because I am getting to be so crabby today.  My kids are driving me crazy, even though they are just being kids. (11 & 13)  My son has a friend over and they are just too loud for what I can handle.  We have a pc and a laptop.  I try to be alone on the computer so I can research this crap but I don't want them to see what I am doing, yet wherever I go, there they are. My S.O. is supposed to come over for a couple hours so we can have a family game night with the kids, but I got angry with him on the phone for no good reason.  Geez, even just trying to type this my 11 year old daughter interrupted me twice.  I need a freaking break. I don't want to think about all of this crap but today was Race for the Cure and everywhere I look I see someone in the t-shirt or wearing pink.  It was even on tv for a couple hours. Having my period in a couple days is not helping my emotional state either.  I just want to get away!!! Can anyone relate? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feeling crabby clevelandgirl99 iLUV2knit

Posts.Content: clevelandgirl99 wrote: I just had my 6 month mammogram.  Was supposed to be a diagnostic, but I changed insurance and wasn't sure if they would consider it a pre-exisiting condition so I had the Dr rewrite the order for a screening.  So of course a week later I get a call saying I need to come back for an ultrasound. I would love to just one time go in for a mammogram and they say "Hey looks good.  See you next year."  Instead I am on this seemingly endless 3 month cycle of mri, 3 months later a mammo, 3 months later an mri, 3 months later another mammo. Hopefully the ultrasound just shows a few cysts and the next mri shows no changes in what they have found and then I can finally be done with all of this nonsense. Is anyone else just plain tired of all of the testing? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Would like for just 1 time to not have to get called back clevelandgirl99 Infobabe
